item.title: Chicken Pasta Bake
item.description:
prep time30 minutes
cook time45 minutes
makes
Can add mushrooms to this dish if needed
Can use cream cheese (Philadelphia) or double cream instead of mascarpone
Can add peppers for some more veg if needed
Add some chunky chorizo for a little extra spice


2 Chicken breasts completionTue, 9 Jul 2024
Diced chorizo
150g Penne completionMon, 11 Mar 2024
70g Mature cheddar completionTue, 9 Jul 2024
50g Grated mozzarella completionSun, 15 Dec 2024
3 tbsp Marscarpone completionTue, 9 Jul 2024
1/2 tsp Chilli flakes completionTue, 2 Jan 2024
2 Garlic cloves completionSat, 27 Jan 2024
1 Onion
1 tin of tomato




Heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a pan over a medium heat and fry the onion gently for 10-12 mins.
Add the garlic and chilli flakes and cook for 1 min.
Tip in the tomatoes and sugar and season to taste.
Simmer uncovered for 20 mins or until thickened, then stir through the mascarpone.


While simmering the sauce, heat 1 tbsp of oil in a non-stick frying pan.
Season the chicken and fry for 5-7 mins or until the chicken is cooked through.


Heat the oven to 200C fan.
Cook the penne following pack instructions.
Drain and toss with the remaining oil.
Tip the pasta into a medium sized ovenproof dish. Stir in the chicken and pour over the sauce.
Top with the cheddar, mozzarella and parsley.
Bake for 20 mins or until golden brown and bubbling.

item.title: Home Assistant
item.description:
You can control the lights and heating in the apartment with an app called Home Assistant.


Download the Home Assistant App from the Play Store (android) or the App Store (iOS).
Open the app, select "Enter Address Manually", and enter https://ha.dbyte.xyz into the prompt.
Log in with your credentials
Username: david, claire, maeve
Password hint: Camper 08
You only need to enable "notifications" for the app to work. All others can be set to "Don't allow".

You should see something like below when you get to the main screen. You can control individual lights, the boiler, and "scenes", which are pre-set light modes.
Tap on a switch to toggle that light or on a scene to enable that scene. The temperature sensors are just for viewing.


The boiler will turn off if it has been on for 3 hours and the living room temperature is above 22 degrees.
The boiler will send a notification to my phone when it has been on for 3 hours.
After 5 hours the boiler will turn off no matter what.
You can still manually control all of the items listed in the app:

The manual control panel on the wall acts as it always has. Boost for 1, 2 or 3 hours, or turn it off if it's currently on.
If the boiler is on (you can hear it), but the manual control panel on the wall says "Off", press the boost button once, wait 5 seconds, then press it again. You'll hear a click and the boiler will turn off.
